intro: Scyphogyne brownii, commonly known as the brown scyphogyne, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Scyphogyne brownii is often found in the understory of rainforests, where it plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat.
